DOC.brief_title: Predicting Success of HFNC: The Utility of the ROX Index
DOC.detailed_description: Purpose The purpose of the study is to describe early predictors and to develop a prediction tool that accurately identifies the need for mechanical ventilation (MV) in pneumonia patients with hypoxemic acute respiratory failure (ARF) treated with high-flow nasal cannula (HFNC). Materials and methods This is a 4-year prospective observational 2-center cohort study including patients with severe pneumonia treated with HFNC. High-flow nasal cannula failure was defined as need for MV. ROX index was defined as the ratio of pulse oximetry/fraction of inspired oxygen to respiratory rate.
DOC.criteria: diagnosis of acute respiratory failure secondary to pneumonia receiving HFNC therapy younger than 18 years old indication for mechanical ventilation at ICU admission limitation of therapeutic effort
